title: Which are the technologies which are discovered but kept hidden from the world? - Quora

response.answer_text: Actually there are a lot of them. Some are mere conspiracies while some are kept secret for a purpose. So here I am gonna tell you about one such ancient invention: Greek Fire  Greek fire was an incendiary weapon first used in Byzantine warfare in 678 CE. You can call it napalm of ancient warfare. It was highly flammable liquid, made of secret ingredients and used both in catapulted incendiary bombs and sprayed under pressure so as to launch flames at enemy ships and fortifications. It was also used with success in defensive situations. Greek Fire became the most devastating weapon for over seven centuries and ensured that Constantinople resisted all attackers. Emperors knew its value and declared that it must absolutely never reach foreign hands. A Secret Formula The invention of Greek Fire is credited to a Christian Greek named Kallinikos (aka Callinicus). Flammable liquids had been used in both Greek and Roman Warfare but nothing had ever been devised that was quite as lethal as Greek Fire. The precise components of the liquid were a closely-guarded secret but a light petroleum or naphtha is one known and vital ingredient. Other ingredients were quicklime, sulphur, resin and potassium nitrate. Some scholars suggest gunpowder was included in the mix. The process of making the liquid was also highly dangerous. The recipe of making Greek Fire was kept in such a secrecy that only emperors and few other selected people knew about it. Now its formula is long lost. It is said that Greek Fire instantaneously set ships ablaze & there was no way of putting out the flames as water had no effect on them. Use in Battle Greek fire was first used in naval engagements where streams of the flaming liquid were fired under pressure towards enemy ships. The dramatic effect of Greek Fire “caused enemies to shiver in terror”. On top of that there was no way of putting out the fire as water had no effect on it. There was very little defence against it either covering the ship in soaked hides, maintaining a safe distance or attacking during storms. Important Victories  *Greek Fire grenades* During the 7th century Arabs were at their peak. They were constantly challenging other empires in the Mediterranean region. During their contest to capture Constantinople, the heart of Byzantine empire, Greek Fire did very well job of resisting the Arabs for long time. It also saved Constantinople city against the attacks of Russian fleets in 10th century. Decline Its usage suddenly stopped around 1200 CE and from then on there was no mention of it being used in wars. The reasons are still unknown. To this date the exact version of Greek Fire, as described in texts hasn't been recreated mainly because of the incomplete knowledge about its ingredient and their exact compositions. Peace ☮️ ……. ✍️ Source : Greek fire | weaponry
